H0.text: The nervous system controls all five senses.

H1.text: The circulatory system controls all five senses.

H2.text: Skin cells control all five senses.

H3.text: The endocrine system controls all five senses.

A4.text: The sensory information from these organs is processed by the brain.

A5.text: The most sophisticated sensory processing occurs inside the brain, but complex feature extraction also takes place in the spinal cord and in peripheral sensory organs such as the retina.
